refnamediv.refpurpose: Lists the names of specified objects in the database in alphabetical order depending on the argument given.

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: The t command with no object argument lists the name of every object in the database (in alphabetical order) except those marked as hidden with the hide command. If the object argument is supplied, only those objects are listed. The object argument may include regular expressions for matching. The following options are also allowed:

listitem.para: a - list all objects in the database.
c - list all nonhidden combinations in the database.
r - list all nonhidden regions in the database.
s - list all nonhidden shapes in the database.

refsection.para: The t command is a synonym for the ls command. Note that when any of the above options are used, the output is not formatted.

refsection.title: EXAMPLES
refsection.para: The five examples show the use of the t command with different arguments to list names of objects, combinations, regions, or shapes.

example.title: List all objects with names beginning with "shape."
example.para: Lists all objects with names beginning with shape. (output is formatted)

example.title: List all objects with names beginning with "shape."
example.para: Lists all objects with names beginning with shape.

example.title: List all shapes with names beginning with wheel.
example.para: Lists all shapes with names beginning with wheel.

example.title: List all regions with names beginning with wheel.
example.para: Lists all regions with names beginning with wheel.

example.title: List all combinations with names beginning with suspension.
example.para: Lists all combinations with names beginning with suspension.

refsection.title: BUG REPORTS
refsection.para: Reports of bugs or problems should be submitted via electronic mail to <devs@brlcad.org>, or via the "cadbug.sh" script.
